intro: Languas polycarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited languas, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small seeds. Languas polycarpa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant flowers and unique foliage.
